ownerdesc: We have created a state-of-the-art banya in which we offer services and a place to revitalize bodies and relax minds. It is a place to meet with old friends, make new ones, or have a quite time just for you refreshing and energizing yourself. Archimedes Banya is a remarkable blend of 'past and present', where ancient traditions of Greek laconica, Turkish hammam, German thermen, Russian banya, etc combine with science and technology to create an experience like no other. Detoxing in perfect heat rooms, plunging in an ice-cold pool, enjoying a breathtaking view on a sun-lit deck, conversing over a delicious meal - you can have it all in a quintessentially San Francisco style. And yet there is more. Famous venik platza, a rich pallet of massages, scrubs, wraps, herbal and mineral baths will help you leave behind the worries of your day and explore new sources of energy.

ownerdesc: Kirk Lombard's Sea Forager Tours celebrate San Francisco's natural bounty in a two and a half hour coastal walking tour that combines history, ecology, gastronomy, and sustainability. This entertaining and educational low-tide foraging expedition along San Francisco's shoreline delights fishermen, foodies, and foragers who learn how to "poke pole" for the flavorful monkeyface eel, catch rock crabs, throw a "Hawaiian casting net," locate the best local mussel beds, and embrace seasonal local fishes.
review: You think that you have to travel far to experience nature. Not so, especially in San Francisco. And especially not with Kirk's Sea Forager tour. I learned a lot, and the tour has inspired me to learn more about foraging and fishing.

memberDescription:
[u'With friends and family living throughout California from north to south, west to east, I enjoy traveling throughout the state frequently.
I also enjoy domestic and international travel.
I enjoy road trips, train trips, car trips, and cruises.
While I enjoy nice resorts, if we plan to see the sights from sun up to sun down, moderate and,safe lodging works just fine.
Fine dining, wineries, and restaurants with a view are quite nice
but picnics in a state or national park, a day at the beach, or family style restaurants are just fine.
We love a range of outdoor activities and we love to explore cities too.
Night life does beckon. When on the road our favorite night life places to go is Los Angeles area or to go to Nevada either Reno or Las Vegas.
In short, travel is amazing. ']

memberDescription:
[u'Retired from classroom teaching after 35 years but working as Flaxmill School network manager. Still involved with SAPSASA athletics and swimming State Championships. Spending heaps of time on the internet..
Margaret and I happily relocated from Hallett Cove in 2007. We are helping granddaughter, Liana, learn about the world in which we live. She turned 11 in 2013. Grandson, Reuben, is 7 years years old.
In the past seven years I have been to New York, Hawaii, Bhutan, Africa, Jordan, Egypt, Rio and the Inca Trail with my daughter, Suzanne. Suzanne also sent us on an Alaskan cruise, a Canadian Trafalgar tour including the Rockies Mountaineer train, to Los Angeles, Las Vegas and the Grand Canyon for our 40th wedding anniversary.
Check out my personal website and photo collection at
http://users.adam.com.au/mmckeen/
email: dadndoc@adam.com.au
Cheers :)
Michael ']

ownerdesc: We have created a state-of-the-art banya in which we offer services and a place to revitalize bodies and relax minds. It is a place to meet with old friends, make new ones, or have a quite time just for you refreshing and energizing yourself. Archimedes Banya is a remarkable blend of 'past and present', where ancient traditions of Greek laconica, Turkish hammam, German thermen, Russian banya, etc combine with science and technology to create an experience like no other. Detoxing in perfect heat rooms, plunging in an ice-cold pool, enjoying a breathtaking view on a sun-lit deck, conversing over a delicious meal - you can have it all in a quintessentially San Francisco style. And yet there is more. Famous venik platza, a rich pallet of massages, scrubs, wraps, herbal and mineral baths will help you leave behind the worries of your day and explore new sources of energy.

Activitiy: Roam Local- Private Walking Tours, San Francisco
ownerdesc: Discover the City by the Bay like a local... on foot! Roam Local walking tours are all approximately four miles each and all cover multiple neighborhoods, hidden stairways, breathtaking vistas, historic landmarks, and beautiful gardens. Four tours to choose from including: Telegraph Hill & the Old Waterfront, the Castro and Mission Loop, Chinatown, North Beach and Russian Hill, and the Four Peaks of Eureka Valley. Tour groups are never more than 6 people.
review: Ryan has a boatload of great, helpful San Francisco knowledge that he is eager to share. Enthusiastic, easy-going, low-key, with iPad accompaniment. Well-planned and -paced. I took the medium-difficulty; I am an active but chubby 58-year-old and I had no problem. Yes, there are a lot of stairs and hills but it's broken up and it's worth it.

name: fromtherock13
CitiesVisited: Lake Mary, FL, USA,Port Orange, FL, USA,Saint Augustine Beach, FL, USA,San Francisco, CA, USA,Amsterdam, The Netherlands,Cayo Coco, Cuba,Albany, NY, USA,Baddeck, Nova Scotia, Canada,Baltimore, MD, USA,Banff, Alberta, Canada,Bangor, ME, USA,Bar Harbor, ME, USA,
ownerdesc: Building on a 30 year history of original, site-specific productions, including the original Alcatraz Cell House Tour, Antenna Theater presents a new kind of tour experience: Magic Bus. Magic Bus blends past and present in a psychedelic journey through San Francisco's rich counter-culture history. This two-hour trip aboard a brightly painted vintage bus weaves a visual narrative of San Francisco from Beatniks to the Summer of Love and beyond! With retractable window screens and digital micro-projectors, Magic Bus uses innovative technology to create a mobile movie theater on a bus. See San Francisco through a new window of altered perception and historical context. Sing along to classic tunes with our hippie hostess. Flash peace signs to passers-by as bubbles swirl from the bus. Stroll through the grass in Golden Gate Park with a flower in your hair, all on your time-traveling adventure aboard Magic Bus!
review: We visited San Francisco in early September with two other couples and had this tour booked in advance. We (the ladies) dressed up in tie-dye shirts, head bands and peace symbol shaped sunglasses. We fit right in with Tree Flower and Jimmie. If you are looking for a different type of bus tour......this is it. Fabulous time had by all!!

name: Deepak617
CitiesVisited: San Francisco, CA, USA,
Activitiy: Isla Studio Photography Classes, San Francisco
ownerdesc: Please join us on a two-hour, light stroll next to San Francisco's beloved, Golden Gate Bridge! Whether you're a San Francisco veteran or a visitor exploring SF for the first time, you will find that the bridge is always most powerful during twilight- or dare we say, "The Golden Hour." It will be a small class of 5-15 people. We'll teach you how to stop relying on automatic, and get those shots worth framing! You'll be able to apply concepts you learned in class like long exposures, depth of field, aperture, shutter speed, rule of thirds and metering. You'll never want to use the "automatic mode" again. Any specific questions about equipment will be answered. Please bring your camera, lens/lenses, and a tripod, if you have one (not mandatory). Once you register, you will receive more details about where to meet.
review: I learned a lot by taking this class. now i have started my own business as a event photographer after taking this class. staff was really helpful.

ownerdesc: Enjoy customized private tours of San Francisco (incl. places the big buses can't go), Napa& Sonoma wine country, Silicon Valley, Carmel, Big Sur. memberDescription: [u'Love nature and outdoor activities. ']
Activitiy: Isla Studio Photography Classes, San Francisco
ownerdesc: Please join us on a two-hour, light stroll next to San Francisco's beloved, Golden Gate Bridge! Whether you're a San Francisco veteran or a visitor exploring SF for the first time, you will find that the bridge is always most powerful during twilight- or dare we say, "The Golden Hour." It will be a small class of 5-15 people. We'll teach you how to stop relying on automatic, and get those shots worth framing! You'll be able to apply concepts you learned in class like long exposures, depth of field, aperture, shutter speed, rule of thirds and metering. You'll never want to use the "automatic mode" again. Any specific questions about equipment will be answered. Please bring your camera, lens/lenses, and a tripod, if you have one (not mandatory). Once you register, you will receive more details about where to meet.
review:
I am onto my second DSLR in the last 7 years and still using it as a "point and shoot" camera. The only setting I know how to use is automatic mode on both of my Nikon & Canon DSLR's. I have the "Rebel T3i/600D for Dummies" book but could not get too far with my learning. I always get...

name: CUL8RLethbridge
CitiesVisited: Lethbridge, Alberta, Canada,New York City, NY, USA,San Francisco, CA, USA,Jodhpur, India,Varkala, India,Hamilton, Ontario, Canada,Palm Springs, CA, USA,Waterton Lakes National Park, Alberta, Canada,Agra, India,Calgary, Alberta, Canada,Kochi (Cochin), India,Thekkady, India,
ownerdesc: Building on a 30 year history of original, site-specific productions, including the original Alcatraz Cell House Tour, Antenna Theater presents a new kind of tour experience: Magic Bus. Magic Bus blends past and present in a psychedelic journey through San Francisco's rich counter-culture history. This two-hour trip aboard a brightly painted vintage bus weaves a visual narrative of San Francisco from Beatniks to the Summer of Love and beyond! With retractable window screens and digital micro-projectors, Magic Bus uses innovative technology to create a mobile movie theater on a bus. See San Francisco through a new window of altered perception and historical context. Sing along to classic tunes with our hippie hostess. Flash peace signs to passers-by as bubbles swirl from the bus. Stroll through the grass in Golden Gate Park with a flower in your hair, all on your time-traveling adventure aboard Magic Bus!
review: Fantastic way to time travel to the late 60s. With flowers in our hair and singing along with the Mamas and Papas ... we were grooving for 2 hours of fun on the Magic Bus. Worth every pemny

name: mini

memberDescription:
[u'With friends and family living throughout California from north to south, west to east, I enjoy traveling throughout the state frequently.
I also enjoy domestic and international travel.
I enjoy road trips, train trips, car trips, and cruises.
While I enjoy nice resorts, if we plan to see the sights from sun up to sun down, moderate and,safe lodging works just fine.
Fine dining, wineries, and restaurants with a view are quite nice
but picnics in a state or national park, a day at the beach, or family style restaurants are just fine.
We love a range of outdoor activities and we love to explore cities too.
Night life does beckon. When on the road our favorite night life places to go is Los Angeles area or to go to Nevada either Reno or Las Vegas.
In short, travel is amazing. ']

ownerdesc: Bay Voyager is happy to announce the opening of our new location at Pier 39 in San Francisco! The range of tours offered by Bay Voyager include viewing historic ships, visiting former mooring sites of abandoned gold rush ships, and experiencing active estuaries populated by cargo ships and tug boats. Youll see the San Francisco waterfront, cruise under the Golden Gate Bridge, around Alcatraz, Under the Bay Bridge to the Port of Oakland, past AT&T Park (Home to the San Francisco Giants) and Back to Pier 39. While Bay Voyager does have specific routes, deviation is an integral part of the experience, making each adventure an engaging and exhilarating encounter.According to owner and captain, Charles Jennings, we feel there is a need to provide more intimate and individualized tours that travel closer and give more in depth guided tours. By being in a small and agile vessel, guests can have an up close and personal adventure while traveling to all corners of the always-fascinating bay.

ownerdesc: Bay Voyager is happy to announce the opening of our new location at Pier 39 in San Francisco! The range of tours offered by Bay Voyager include viewing historic ships, visiting former mooring sites of abandoned gold rush ships, and experiencing active estuaries populated by cargo ships and tug boats. Youll see the San Francisco waterfront, cruise under the Golden Gate Bridge, around Alcatraz, Under the Bay Bridge to the Port of Oakland, past AT&T Park (Home to the San Francisco Giants) and Back to Pier 39. While Bay Voyager does have specific routes, deviation is an integral part of the experience, making each adventure an engaging and exhilarating encounter.According to owner and captain, Charles Jennings, we feel there is a need to provide more intimate and individualized tours that travel closer and give more in depth guided tours. By being in a small and agile vessel, guests can have an up close and personal adventure while traveling to all corners of the always-fascinating bay.

CitiesVisited: Florence, Italy,Healdsburg, CA, USA,New York City, NY, USA,San Francisco, CA, USA,Taveuni Island, Fiji,Chicago, IL, USA,Austin, TX, USA,Buffalo, NY, USA,Grand Island, NY, USA,Albuquerque, NM, USA,Boston, MA, USA,Capri, Italy,
ownerdesc: Offering traditional Thai massage in a clean, relaxing environment, Royal Thai Spa is a much-needed urban escape.What makes Royal Thai Spa massage different? For starters, its performed on comfortable mats on the raised hardwood floor, allowing your therapist to go deeply into the knots and bunches of your back and neck.Thai massage also incorporates stretching and yoga-like postures, leaving you feeling open, light, and aware of your entire body.This style of bodywork has been practiced for centuries, and is rapidly gaining new followers with its recent resurgence.Try Royal Thai Spas convenient online booking, and see just how easy it can be to find the relief that so many others have known about for years.

memberDescription:
[u'With friends and family living throughout California from north to south, west to east, I enjoy traveling throughout the state frequently.
I also enjoy domestic and international travel.
I enjoy road trips, train trips, car trips, and cruises.
While I enjoy nice resorts, if we plan to see the sights from sun up to sun down, moderate and,safe lodging works just fine.
Fine dining, wineries, and restaurants with a view are quite nice
but picnics in a state or national park, a day at the beach, or family style restaurants are just fine.
We love a range of outdoor activities and we love to explore cities too.
Night life does beckon. When on the road our favorite night life places to go is Los Angeles area or to go to Nevada either Reno or Las Vegas.
In short, travel is amazing. ']

[u'Working single Mom to 3 beautiful, smart girls. One married and has my only grandson; one in her 5th year of college; & the baby, who now is in her 2nd year of college, with her sister, they share an apartment and doing well.

Activitiy: Wok Wiz Chinatown Tours, San Francisco
ownerdesc: Strolls of San Francisco's Chinatown highlighting its history, people, culture and food with an optional casual dim sum lunch at the end. Award-winning and plenty of fun, our team of tour leaders are all born in Chinatown, are articulate and receive rave reviews - join us soon!Wok Wiz Tours has been in business for over 25 years and was founded by the late chef/author Shirley Fong-Torres who designed her tours to showcase one of the most remarkable neighborhoods in San Francisco: Chinatown. Each year, we bring thousands of guests, of all ages, from near and far, to our vibrant area. Every Wok Wiz tour leader was either born in, or grew up in Chinatown, giving a very local flavor to the tour, and each speaks fluent English as well as Chinese.Wok Wiz Chinatown Tours remains a San Francisco icon. Featured in the NY Times, LA Times, USA Today, Bon Appetit, Gourmet, and Cooking Light, and multiple guide books such as Fodor's and Frommer's, the tours are touted as "top attractions" in the city.
review:

ownerdesc: Offering traditional Thai massage in a clean, relaxing environment, Royal Thai Spa is a much-needed urban escape.What makes Royal Thai Spa massage different? For starters, its performed on comfortable mats on the raised hardwood floor, allowing your therapist to go deeply into the knots and bunches of your back and neck.Thai massage also incorporates stretching and yoga-like postures, leaving you feeling open, light, and aware of your entire body.This style of bodywork has been practiced for centuries, and is rapidly gaining new followers with its recent resurgence.Try Royal Thai Spas convenient online booking, and see just how easy it can be to find the relief that so many others have known about for years.

name: StrandsDanville
CitiesVisited: San Francisco, CA, USA,Yellowstone National Park, WY, USA,Yosemite National Park, CA, USA,San Diego, CA, USA,Napa Valley,Carmel, CA, USA,Los Angeles, CA, USA,Monterey, CA, USA,Sonoma, CA, USA,Napa, CA, USA,Prague, Czech Republic,Cesky Krumlov, Czech Republic,
memberDescription:
[u"My wife and I are in our upper 50's! We, like others on TA, just love global travel!
Our very independent trips typically last 10-21 days with very detailed upfront planning in concentrated areas. See our Trip Lists for some of our excursions.
Compared to most, we are very active each day because we want to do everything: Hiking, golf, skiing, biking, picnics, fine dining, wine tasting, museums & scenic drives. We still find time for reading and crosswords.
Our budget (fairly high) demands value for price paid. We do not camp. Food and wine is a real focus on every trip. Where we enjoy each meal is carefully chosen. Mr Strand eats anything except s'mores. We have extensively toured several wine regions around the globe (New Zealand, Australia, all areas of Europe and of course here in CA, OR & WA)
Recently we have started renting and really enjoying VRBO properties. We seek out ranger led programs and hire private guides in historic cultural centers.
Enjoy is our favorite word! "]
Activitiy: Rick Evans Architecture Walking Tour, San Francisco
review:
Impassioned Rick Evans, an architectural historian, presents a jam-packed 2 hours of captivating narrative about urban development evolution with great real life props!
His tour covers the rich historical spectrum of San Francisco from its Gold Rush Boom to the current futuristic Tech Cloud Boom. Afterwards your perspective will change with air being a hot commodity, terracotta being your new...

name: SkiAlberta
CitiesVisited: San Pedro, Belize,San Francisco, CA, USA,Sorrento, Italy,Belmopan, Belize,Canmore, Alberta, Canada,Grand Canyon National Park, AZ, USA,Lahaina, HI, USA,Lake Tahoe (California),Las Vegas, NV, USA,Manarola, Italy,Nice, France,Stateline, NV, USA,
ownerdesc: Bike the Bridge! At Blazing Saddles Bike Rentals and Tours we want our guests to come away from a day on our bikes feeling as if they have just experienced the very best that our city has to offer. Whether it is a local resident enjoying our state of the art equipment or a visitor seeing the city for the first time, we encourage our riders to enjoy the bike friendly environment of San Francisco. Blazing Saddles was one of the first in the industry to develop a proprietary map of suggested routes and points of interest, and we have been a major pioneer in promoting cycling through the Presidio National Park, over the Golden Gate Bridge and into Sausalito and Tiburon. All of our seven locations in San Francisco have easy access to a car-free bike path that winds around the city by the bay. We have the largest fleet of bikes in San Francisco, including state of the art electric bikes, tandems and kids bikes. We also have high performance road and mountain bikes for those who want to explore Golden Gate National Recreation Area and Mt. Tamalpais State Park. We rent bikes 365 days a year and we open at 8am every day. For those that want something more we offer a daily tour with a friendly and knowledgeable guide. No reservations necessary, so come on down when youre ready to Bike the Bridge!
review:
Very good people and operation right off pier 39. Whether it is a local resident enjoying our state of the art equipment or a visitor seeing the city for the first time, we encourage our riders to enjoy the bike friendly environment of San Francisco. Blazing Saddles was one of the first in the industry to develop a proprietary map of suggested routes and points of interest, and we have been a major pioneer in promoting cycling through the Presidio National Park, over the Golden Gate Bridge and into Sausalito and Tiburon. All of our seven locations in San Francisco have easy access to a car-free bike path that winds around the city by the bay. We have the largest fleet of bikes in San Francisco, including state of the art electric bikes, tandems and kids bikes. We also have high performance road and mountain bikes for those who want to explore Golden Gate National Recreation Area and Mt. Tamalpais State Park. We rent bikes 365 days a year and we open at 8am every day. For those that want something more we offer a daily tour with a friendly and knowledgeable guide. No reservations necessary, so come on down when youre ready to Bike the Bridge!
review:
We decided to take this bike ride to cross the Golden Gate and after many reviews we went for Blazing Saddles.
Very nice service from the very beginning with focus on safety. They were very nice to explain the route and different options to return the bike if we decided to take other routes or stay longer.
The bikes were...

Activitiy: Streets of San Francisco Bike Tours, San Francisco
ownerdesc: SoSF is your #1 source for all things biking San Francisco. We know the city's best bike routes, especially the ones that go around the hills. We show you San Francisco's wild history and modern trends, including food, art, music, kooky local politics, and, of course, all things bicycles. Our guided bike tours focus on the city's neighborhoods and include: Unique history, diverse neighborhoods, Victorian architecture, public art, awesome bikes, & tasty local cuisine. Fun, friendly, local guides lead you through safe, bike-friendly routes that go around those infamous hills. Discounts for students, teachers, and military. We offer 3 guided tours in spring and 4 in summer: Heart of the City: 3-3.5 Hrs, $65/person, about 9 miles: Explore the city's interior neighborhoods including the Mission, Haight-Ashbury, and Civic Center. The Classic: 4.5-5 Hrs, $89/person, about 12 miles: Everything the Heart of the City has plus the Castro, SoMa, some additional stops, and a lunch break to taste delicious local cuisine. 7X7: 5.5-6 Hrs, $99/person, 17-18 miles with a stop for lunch. This tour is our epic day out on the bikes circumnavigating the city! The Bay Roller: (Summer only) 4.5-5 Hrs, $89/person explores the culture and history of San Francisco's northeastern neighborhoods and famous waterfront landscapes.
review:

memberDescription: [u"As a kid my travel was limited to a trip to the White Mountains of New Hampshire for foliage once a year, Gloucester for sea food the same once a year, and to Ohio to visit my grandparents. At the age of 12 my parents put me on an airplane to visit cousins in near Syracuse NY and the world began to open up. I developed a love for my home city of Boston, MA and a desire to see the world. It wasn't until I entered the work force that I really got to travel, and at that it wasn't always the nicest spots in the US (I was in the chemical industry). Never the less, I drank up each location like I was in the desert. It was my first trip to the Rockies in 1986 however, that would change my life. There I met my future husband (who lived near Boston like me) and who loved travel and had the drive and found the means to do it. As much as I love my home in southern CA, I've often got the wanderlust and drag my kids and husband along as much as I can manage. I "]
review: Finally somewhere with more books than junk (hear me B&N). Great shop to discover new authors, enjoy some staff recommendations, or just talk the joy of reading with the staff. A book lover's jewel in the Haight.

memberDescription: [u"I love to travel and see different places. I usually travel alone. So the palces I visits are places that have good public transportation. I plan my travels months ahead. I usually asked for travel magazine from the tourism of the places I plan to visit. I check the places that they recommend, check the map, plan on how to get there. I am a traveler on a budget. I checked the cheapest hotel with free breakfast and wifi most of the time. I don't need a fancy hotel for I am always out during the day, I just need a place to stay during the night. I had membership on some hotel groups so that I can get a good discount. I look for good airfare deal by subscribing from airfare alert. If the place doesn't need an airfare I search for the cheapest bus or train. I plan every detail of my travel including my itineraries and the weather. If I go overseas, I prefer to travel in group. I look for tour groups online for I don't think it is a good idea to travel alone in a foreign country. "]

name: JoshATAK
CitiesVisited: Los Angeles, CA, USA,Culver City, CA, USA,San Francisco, CA, USA,Palm Desert, CA, USA,Marina del Rey, CA, USA,
Activitiy: Gears and Grapes Getaways, San Francisco
ownerdesc: Gears and Grapes Getaways offers day trips to Napa Valley, Dry Creek Valley and the Russian River Valley.Our day trips include pick up and drop off in San Francisco! Experience Northern Californias wine country in an exciting new way, by pedaling through it first-hand. Learn more about wine than ever before from our expert on-staff sommeliers. We will take you to our hand-selected vineyards that produce some of the highest quality wine in Northern California. Our experienced tour guides and staff are trained sommeliers, who have authentic wine knowledge that you cant find anywhere else.Leaving San Francisco at 9am, a shuttle will take you across the Golden Gate Bridge into wine country. Once there, we will set you up on bikes and a guide will lead you from winery to winery. We will stop for a delicious picnic lunch amongst the vineyards. A shuttle will follow the group to carry any purchases or assist any riders who decide they would rather be driven. Biking the whole way is optional. At any point, guests may choose to ride in the shuttle. We return to the city by 7pm.All trips include bike, shuttle, 2 guides, transport to and from SF, lunch, snacks and 4 winery visits.
review:
I have been on many a wine tour, but never have i had the experience that i had on the Gears and Grapes tour. While riding my bike between wineries i actually got a feel for the grapes on the vine and what it takes to develop the amazing flavors of a wine. The tour guide is an actual cetified...

name: MattG138
CitiesVisited: San Francisco, CA, USA,Round Rock, TX, USA,Taos, NM, USA,Washington DC, DC, USA,
Activitiy: Red and White Fleet, San Francisco
ownerdesc: Founded in 1892, the family-owned Red and White Fleet is San Francisco's original sightseeing adventure and only multilingual sightseeing cruise. All of Red and White Fleet's cruises depart from Pier 43 at the end of Taylor Street, in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf.Sail under the Golden Gate and around Alcatraz aboard the 1-hr Golden Gate Bay Cruise featuring headphone audio about San Francisco sights and history in 12 languages; 8-12 daily cruises starting at 10AM. Or enjoy amazing sunset views, live music and hearty appetizers aboard the relaxed 2-hr California Sunset Cruise with sailings from April-October. Winter departures are offered aboard the California Twilight Cruise from November through March.The 90-min Bridge 2 Bridge Cruise promises spectacular views of the entire San Francisco skyline, from the Golden Gate Bridge all the way to the Bay Bridge with year-round sailings. Tours feature headphone audio in 12 languages.Red and White Fleet also offers a variety of tours on land for sale, from hop-on hop-off tours, to motor coach excursions to the Napa & Sonoma Wine Country, Monterey & Carmel, Muir Woods & Sausalito, and Yosemite.
review: You get a good view of city - if you want to hang-out, drink beer, see city. It's ok. There is no history of city, but I think our tour guide was Mia and the guy who filled in was terrible. The singer was very good.

Winter departures are offered aboard the California Twilight Cruise from November through March.The 90-min Bridge 2 Bridge Cruise promises spectacular views of the entire San Francisco skyline, from the Golden Gate Bridge all the way to the Bay Bridge with year-round sailings. Tours feature headphone audio in 12 languages.Red and White Fleet also offers a variety of tours on land for sale, from hop-on hop-off tours, to motor coach excursions to the Napa & Sonoma Wine Country, Monterey & Carmel, Muir Woods & Sausalito, and Yosemite.
review:
Very good tour of the bay and audio guide was really informative and interesting.
Plenty of photo opportunities of all the key sights on and off shore.
Definitely recommend the 1hr tour which takes you around Alcatraz and under the Golden Gate Bridge.

name: ravi.cosmo
CitiesVisited: Paihia, New Zealand,San Francisco, CA, USA,Mill Valley, CA, USA,Washington DC, DC, USA,Anaheim, CA, USA,Gurgaon, India,Los Angeles, CA, USA,Madurai, India,Pune, India,Queenstown, New Zealand,Tirunelveli, India,
Activitiy: The Real S.F. Tour, San Francisco
ownerdesc: The Real SF Tour offers 4 incredible tours merging sightseeing and trekking with public transit for the most authentic visitor experience in San Francisco. Part urban adventure, part urban trek, and totally green, The Real SF Tours take you where no other tours can go. Youll visit enchanted gardens, secret stairways, glorious rooftop views, and some of the citys coolest neighbourhoods. Youll be avoiding large crowds of tourists while experiencing the real culture of San Francisco and learning about its rich and storied history. Youll traverse the city on Cable Cars, Light Rail, and City Buses. You must be able to walk 4 separate uphill 1.5 block sections, there are a total of 6 uphill flights of stairs, and 15 downhill flights of stairs, spread throughout the day. The day encompasses over 5 miles of walking including short uphill sections and hidden stairways that most people find extremely enjoyable. If you do not walk regularly this tour may be more challenging than enjoyable. If you have any difficulty going up and downstairs we do not recommend this tour. Please only wear comfortable closed toe walking shoes. Tours run daily departing from the California St Cable Car turnaround.
review:
In my 3 week, first US trip, I've really liked the walking tours to get to know a city. Thoroughly enjoyed my tours in DC and New York.

memberDescription:
[u'With friends and family living throughout California from north to south, west to east, I enjoy traveling throughout the state frequently.
I also enjoy domestic and international travel.
I enjoy road trips, train trips, car trips, and cruises.
While I enjoy nice resorts, if we plan to see the sights from sun up to sun down, moderate and,safe lodging works just fine.
Fine dining, wineries, and restaurants with a view are quite nice
but picnics in a state or national park, a day at the beach, or family style restaurants are just fine.
We love a range of outdoor activities and we love to explore cities too.
Night life does beckon. When on the road our favorite night life places to go is Los Angeles area or to go to Nevada either Reno or Las Vegas.
In short, travel is amazing. ']

Activitiy: Electric Tour Company Segway Tours, San Francisco
ownerdesc: The original San Francisco Segway and Electric Bike Tour company. Come glide through San Francisco with us. Segways are easy to learn and fun to ride. We offer 2.5 hour fully guided and narrated Segway tours of the waterfront, North Beach, Chinatown and Golden Gate Park.Chose from 4 fun routes with frequent daily and evening departures. We have 2 convenient locations: Fisherman's Wharf and Golden Gate Park.Our tours are fun and informative. Read our reviews - we love having fiun snd so do our guests. We offer entertaining and thourough Segway rider training before you depart to explore and learn about the city We gurantee a personal experience with our small groups of 9 or less guests per tour guide.( 8 or less in the Park) Not only are the segways fun to ride you will enjoy hearing stories, history and itales of the city. Each rider is issued a small radio receiver with a earbud so the tour narration can be heard as you glide from one scenic location to another. We want you to be safe and visible as we travel along many bike lanes so everybody gets (and some dislike) our highly visible and reflective vests. Warm jackets, fuzzy gloves and rain gear are alll available at no charge if the fog, wind or rain makes an appearance.All Segway guests must be age 12 and older plus over 100 lbs. (45kg) Eletric Bike tours ages 16 and up. No pregnant guests .Choose from these tours: Wharf and Waterfront Segway Adventure, Night Segway tour of Chinatown, Little Italy and Waterfront or the official Golden Gate Park Segway Tour. For riders that have been on segway tour before we offer a Hills of San Francisco advanced rider tour that includes the crookedest street and Telegraph Hill.All Segway tours are $ 70.00 per person and advanced reservations are encouraged.
review:
We did a private tour for two around golden gate park. ownerdesc: The original San Francisco Segway and Electric Bike Tour company. Come glide through San Francisco with us. Segways are easy to learn and fun to ride. We offer 2.5 hour fully guided and narrated Segway tours of the waterfront, North Beach, Chinatown and Golden Gate Park.Chose from 4 fun routes with frequent daily and evening departures. We have 2 convenient locations: Fisherman's Wharf and Golden Gate Park.Our tours are fun and informative. Read our reviews - we love having fiun snd so do our guests. We offer entertaining and thourough Segway rider training before you depart to explore and learn about the city We gurantee a personal experience with our small groups of 9 or less guests per tour guide.( 8 or less in the Park) Not only are the segways fun to ride you will enjoy hearing stories, history and itales of the city. Each rider is issued a small radio receiver with a earbud so the tour narration can be heard as you glide from one scenic location to another. We want you to be safe and visible as we travel along many bike lanes so everybody gets (and some dislike) our highly visible and reflective vests. Warm jackets, fuzzy gloves and rain gear are alll available at no charge if the fog, wind or rain makes an appearance.All Segway guests must be age 12 and older plus over 100 lbs. (45kg) Eletric Bike tours ages 16 and up. No pregnant guests .Choose from these tours: Wharf and Waterfront Segway Adventure, Night Segway tour of Chinatown, Little Italy and Waterfront or the official Golden Gate Park Segway Tour. For riders that have been on segway tour before we offer a Hills of San Francisco advanced rider tour that includes the crookedest street and Telegraph Hill.All Segway tours are $ 70.00 per person and advanced reservations are encouraged.
review:
The Electric Tour Company had been recommended to us by a friend whom had attended their Segway tour earlier in the year... but we were looking for something other than a typical sightseeing tour. name: RegularWithMilk
CitiesVisited: San Francisco, CA, USA,Calistoga, CA, USA,Napa, CA, USA,Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada,Kitchener, Ontario, Canada,Moosonee, Ontario, Canada,Oakville, CA, USA,Sausalito, CA, USA,Thunder Bay, Ontario, Canada,Angwin, CA, USA,Fort Frances, Ontario, Canada,Rutherford, CA, USA,
Activitiy: The Real S.F. Tour, San Francisco
ownerdesc: The Real SF Tour offers 4 incredible tours merging sightseeing and trekking with public transit for the most authentic visitor experience in San Francisco. Part urban adventure, part urban trek, and totally green, The Real SF Tours take you where no other tours can go. Youll visit enchanted gardens, secret stairways, glorious rooftop views, and some of the citys coolest neighbourhoods. Youll be avoiding large crowds of tourists while experiencing the real culture of San Francisco and learning about its rich and storied history. Youll traverse the city on Cable Cars, Light Rail, and City Buses. You must be able to walk 4 separate uphill 1.5 block sections, there are a total of 6 uphill flights of stairs, and 15 downhill flights of stairs, spread throughout the day. The day encompasses over 5 miles of walking including short uphill sections and hidden stairways that most people find extremely enjoyable. If you do not walk regularly this tour may be more challenging than enjoyable. If you have any difficulty going up and downstairs we do not recommend this tour. Please only wear comfortable closed toe walking shoes. Tours run daily departing from the California St Cable Car turnaround.
review:
This was my most anticipated event while we were in San Francisco. I had high expectations based on reviews I had read online. I was not disappointed!

Activitiy: Green Dream Tours - Wine Country Tour Specialist, San Francisco
ownerdesc: We specialize exclusively in Wine Country Tours, offering tours to Napa Valley and Sonoma Valley, seven days per week. Private wine country tours are available to Napa and Sonoma anytime for groups of any size. Our Sonoma Valley Tour is the only tour that includes a complete picnic lunch. The Sonoma tour also includes: all of your tasting fees free of charge, pickup and drop-off at your hotel, complimentary water, a winery tour, a one hour visit to the town of Sonoma, and a photo stop at the Golden Gate Bridge! memberDescription:
[u'With friends and family living throughout California from north to south, west to east, I enjoy traveling throughout the state frequently.
I also enjoy domestic and international travel.
I enjoy road trips, train trips, car trips, and cruises.
While I enjoy nice resorts, if we plan to see the sights from sun up to sun down, moderate and,safe lodging works just fine.
Fine dining, wineries, and restaurants with a view are quite nice
but picnics in a state or national park, a day at the beach, or family style restaurants are just fine.
We love a range of outdoor activities and we love to explore cities too.
Night life does beckon. When on the road our favorite night life places to go is Los Angeles area or to go to Nevada either Reno or Las Vegas.
In short, travel is amazing. ']
review: Nordstrom is an enjoyable show to shop at at Westfield San Francisco Centre. There are various floors including a cafe.

memberDescription:
[u'With friends and family living throughout California from north to south, west to east, I enjoy traveling throughout the state frequently.
I also enjoy domestic and international travel.
I enjoy road trips, train trips, car trips, and cruises.
While I enjoy nice resorts, if we plan to see the sights from sun up to sun down, moderate and,safe lodging works just fine.
Fine dining, wineries, and restaurants with a view are quite nice
but picnics in a state or national park, a day at the beach, or family style restaurants are just fine.
We love a range of outdoor activities and we love to explore cities too.
Night life does beckon. When on the road our favorite night life places to go is Los Angeles area or to go to Nevada either Reno or Las Vegas.
In short, travel is amazing. ']

memberDescription: [u"We love being strangers in a strange land. Walking, walking to feel the history, beauty, physical environment, interact with local people, usually on our own.\nI love a real camera to take quality photos. It makes me stop and really see things, and a good zoom reveals details the naked eye misses. I make old-fashioned albums because I love books; I want to keep the glow of that journey available at a glance; and the story can be shared, should people actually be willing to see one's vacation pictures!\nWe try to go to performances wherever we are: flamenco in Coronado, dance in Cambodia, theater in London, music everywhere. In a small town in Transylvania we snuck into a Beethoven's 9th that was unforgettable! We find these events on our own, often on our rambles. It steeps you in the culture as it continues to be expressed. "]

Type: City walk sightseeing, Group tours/walking tour
ownerdesc: From its vantage point overlooking the spectacular Golden Gate, Fort Point protected San Francisco harbor from Confederate and foreign attack during and after the U.S. Civil War. Its beautifully arched casemates display the art of the master brick mason from the Civil War period.

name: helryder

Type:
Acquerello, named for its original watercolors, envelops guests in a warm and gracious atmosphere the moment they arrive. A recent renovation of the 22-year old restaurant, led by designer John Wheatman, highlights the former chapel, graced with arches and a
rustic wood-beamed vaulted ceiling, with warm Mediterranean colors of gold and terracotta.
The 50 seat dining room is softly illuminated with light from polished brass lamps which dances off an extensive collection of crystal decanters and a large floral bouquet greeting guests as they enter.
Co-owners Giancarlo Paterlini and Suzette Gresham-Tognetti work together to provide an unparalleled Italian dining experience. Acquerello has received countless awards, including a Michelin star in the first-ever 2007 Bay Area guide.
review: This was in my top five restaurant experiences ever! My partner and I did the five course menu and loved it, the food was simply devine... Would highly recommend the gnocchi (which was heaven on a plate) and the chocolate mousse. The service was impeccable and the wine recommendations were sensational. It's pricey but worth every penny.

memberDescription: [u"I was born into a family where I was lucky enough to be able to travel since I was very young. My father used to work for Pan Am, and even though we were not well off, my mother was smart and always saved money for overseas trips. This is how my love for traveling began. I am married to someone who is in the airline industry as well, so my passion continues. I travel with my spouse outside the United States at least once a year, and have done the same with our children (23 and 19). I consider myself a budget traveler. I believe I know what to expect depending on where I go. I do not take tours, but read books and guides to familiarize myself with what I'll see and do. I do a lot of walking and use public transportation. I love meeting new people and new cultures. "]
review:
Great pizza. We were walking down Russian Hill and saw this small place full of people. Luckily it was between dining peak hours, because when we finished eating, there was a long line of people waiting for a table. We had a large potesto pizza. name: mini
CitiesVisited: San Francisco, CA, USA,Los Angeles, CA, USA,Napa, CA, USA,Las Vegas, NV, USA,Yosemite National Park, CA, USA,San Diego, CA, USA,San Jose, CA, USA,Anaheim, CA, USA,Napa Valley,Sonoma, CA, USA,Reno, NV, USA,Monterey, CA, USA,
memberDescription:
[u'With friends and family living throughout California from north to south, west to east, I enjoy traveling throughout the state frequently.
I also enjoy domestic and international travel.
I enjoy road trips, train trips, car trips, and cruises.
While I enjoy nice resorts, if we plan to see the sights from sun up to sun down, moderate and,safe lodging works just fine.
Fine dining, wineries, and restaurants with a view are quite nice
but picnics in a state or national park, a day at the beach, or family style restaurants are just fine.
We love a range of outdoor activities and we love to explore cities too.
Night life does beckon. When on the road our favorite night life places to go is Los Angeles area or to go to Nevada either Reno or Las Vegas.
In short, travel is amazing. ']
review: We have enjoyed going to the opera in San Francisco. It is one of the world's great opera companies.

memberDescription: [u'I love exploring new restaurants throughout the country. Instead of going to the commercial tourist spots, I like to "off" the beaten path and find small family-owned restaurants (they usually have their own specialties). My favorite food is seafood (I live in California) and grew up with scuba diving parents, so fresh caught is all I will eat (or flash frozen fresh). I like restaurants and hotels that are consistent in their food and service, otherwise I won\'t return. To date, San Francisco is by far my best culinary experience because of the many different types of foods you can find and the creativity that San Francisco has to offer with a huge variety of fruits, vegatables, meats and seafood living next to the nations greenbelt.\nI will try anything once, or twice depending on where I am and whether the establishment has a different way of preparing the food. ']

memberDescription: [u"We love being strangers in a strange land. Walking, walking to feel the history, beauty, physical environment, interact with local people, usually on our own.\nI love a real camera to take quality photos. It makes me stop and really see things, and a good zoom reveals details the naked eye misses. I make old-fashioned albums because I love books; I want to keep the glow of that journey available at a glance; and the story can be shared, should people actually be willing to see one's vacation pictures!\nWe try to go to performances wherever we are: flamenco in Coronado, dance in Cambodia, theater in London, music everywhere. In a small town in Transylvania we snuck into a Beethoven's 9th that was unforgettable! We find these events on our own, often on our rambles. It steeps you in the culture as it continues to be expressed. "]
review: Beautiful building in Civic Center, filled with lots of sculptures from many countries; Japanese and Chinese screens; pots and rugs, etc., all well displayed and curated. Great gift shop, too!

name: Susan_Richmond
CitiesVisited: San Francisco, CA, USA,Siem Reap, Cambodia,Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam,Ubud, Indonesia,Cordoba, Spain,Granada, Spain,Oakland, CA, USA,Transylvania,Amsterdam, The Netherlands,Anaheim, CA, USA,Barcelona, Spain,Beijing, China,
memberDescription: [u"We love being strangers in a strange land. Walking, walking to feel the history, beauty, physical environment, interact with local people, usually on our own.\nI love a real camera to take quality photos. It makes me stop and really see things, and a good zoom reveals details the naked eye misses. I make old-fashioned albums because I love books; I want to keep the glow of that journey available at a glance; and the story can be shared, should people actually be willing to see one's vacation pictures!\nWe try to go to performances wherever we are: flamenco in Coronado, dance in Cambodia, theater in London, music everywhere. In a small town in Transylvania we snuck into a Beethoven's 9th that was unforgettable! We find these events on our own, often on our rambles. It steeps you in the culture as it continues to be expressed. "]
ownerdesc: On June 7, 1974, Steve Silver produced a small show in the back room of the Savoy Tivoli Restaurant in San Francisco. The show was to run for six weeks. That was over 37 years ago... Today, Steve Silver's Beach Blanket Babylon has the distinguished title of "World's Longest Running Musical Revue." The show - a musical spoof known internationally for its extravagant costumes, outrageous hats, show-stopping numbers and hilarious puns of pop culture and political character - has been seen by over 5.5 Million people, including HRC Queen Elizabeth II, Prince Charles and Camilla the Duchess of Cornwall as well as some of Hollywood's biggest stars."Steve Silver's Beach Blanket Babylon," hailed as "a constant cascade of showstoppers" by the "San Francisco Chronicle", follows Snow White as she takes a fast-paced journey around the world in search of her "Prince Charming." Along the way she encounters a star-studded, ever-changing line-up of hilarious pop-culture characters, including President Barack & Michelle Obama, Gangnam Style, Prince William, Kate Middleton and the Queen of England, Honey Boo Boo, Governor Jerry Brown, Justin Bieber, Nicki Minaj, Hilary & Bill Clinton, Oprah Winfrey, Nancy Pelosi, Michael Jackson, Adele, General David Patraeus, "50 Shades of Grey," and The San Francisco Giants.
review: This is a good-natured show, with crazy costumes, silly skits and raucous music. An old-fashioned kind of entertainment, sweet and funny.

ownerdesc: On June 7, 1974, Steve Silver produced a small show in the back room of the Savoy Tivoli Restaurant in San Francisco. The show was to run for six weeks. That was over 37 years ago... Today, Steve Silver's Beach Blanket Babylon has the distinguished title of "World's Longest Running Musical Revue." The show - a musical spoof known internationally for its extravagant costumes, outrageous hats, show-stopping numbers and hilarious puns of pop culture and political character - has been seen by over 5.5 Million people, including HRC Queen Elizabeth II, Prince Charles and Camilla the Duchess of Cornwall as well as some of Hollywood's biggest stars."Steve Silver's Beach Blanket Babylon," hailed as "a constant cascade of showstoppers" by the "San Francisco Chronicle", follows Snow White as she takes a fast-paced journey around the world in search of her "Prince Charming." Along the way she encounters a star-studded, ever-changing line-up of hilarious pop-culture characters, including President Barack & Michelle Obama, Gangnam Style, Prince William, Kate Middleton and the Queen of England, Honey Boo Boo, Governor Jerry Brown, Justin Bieber, Nicki Minaj, Hilary & Bill Clinton, Oprah Winfrey, Nancy Pelosi, Michael Jackson, Adele, General David Patraeus, "50 Shades of Grey," and The San Francisco Giants.
review: Changing the themeon a yearly basis keeps this show amusing. I have been to Beach Blanket Babylon 5 times and at each show I was very entertained! I would go every year if I lived in San Francisco! The show is very well put together and very amusing! A must see when visiting San Francisco!

review: Must see for a relaxing activity in San francisco on pier 39 at the aquarium theater! Tim is simply funny, exciting and talented. Very close to his crowd, he knows how to put a smile on your face. Bring your innerchild along!

review: Be careful when you park in lots that you do not get a con artist to tell you where to park. Many are unattended and you get a ticket from a machine or pay the slot for your care number. I was told to park, gave him my cash and got a ticket at the end of the day.

name: graye
CitiesVisited: Houston, TX, USA,San Francisco, CA, USA,Washington DC, DC, USA,Austin, TX, USA,New York City, NY, USA,Seattle, WA, USA,Honolulu, HI, USA,New Braunfels, TX, USA,San Antonio, TX, USA,Santa Monica, CA, USA,Atlantic City, NJ, USA,Cedar Creek, TX, USA,
ownerdesc: On June 7, 1974, Steve Silver produced a small show in the back room of the Savoy Tivoli Restaurant in San Francisco. The show was to run for six weeks. That was over 37 years ago... Today, Steve Silver's Beach Blanket Babylon has the distinguished title of "World's Longest Running Musical Revue." The show - a musical spoof known internationally for its extravagant costumes, outrageous hats, show-stopping numbers and hilarious puns of pop culture and political character - has been seen by over 5.5 Million people, including HRC Queen Elizabeth II, Prince Charles and Camilla the Duchess of Cornwall as well as some of Hollywood's biggest stars."Steve Silver's Beach Blanket Babylon," hailed as "a constant cascade of showstoppers" by the "San Francisco Chronicle", follows Snow White as she takes a fast-paced journey around the world in search of her "Prince Charming." Along the way she encounters a star-studded, ever-changing line-up of hilarious pop-culture characters, including President Barack & Michelle Obama, Gangnam Style, Prince William, Kate Middleton and the Queen of England, Honey Boo Boo, Governor Jerry Brown, Justin Bieber, Nicki Minaj, Hilary & Bill Clinton, Oprah Winfrey, Nancy Pelosi, Michael Jackson, Adele, General David Patraeus, "50 Shades of Grey," and The San Francisco Giants.
review: Highly recommend attending the San Francisco classic, Beach Blanket Babylon. The cast is entertaining and loved the costuming.

review: Very, nice hiking trails high up on the cliffs at the mouth of the bay. It's a good place to get away from the crowds and the usual tourist spots. Follow the road down to the bottom of the hill and spend some time looking at the waves and watching the surfers.
